options: Evaluating constant expressions at compile time
questions.explanation: Constant folding evaluates expressions with known constant values at compile time rather than runtime.

options: Replacing expensive operations with equivalent cheaper ones
questions.explanation: Strength reduction replaces expensive operations (e.g., multiply) with cheaper equivalents (e.g., shift).

options: Reusing previously computed values instead of recomputing
questions.explanation: CSE identifies expressions computed multiple times and reuses the first computation.

options: Removing code whose results are never used
questions.explanation: Dead code elimination removes computations whose results are never used by the program.

options: Replacing variable uses with their known values after assignment
questions.explanation: Copy propagation replaces uses of a variable with its value when the value is a copy of another variable.

questions.prompt: What is loop invariant code motion?
options: Moving computations that don't change across iterations out of the loop
questions.explanation: Loop invariant code motion hoists computations whose values don't change across iterations outside the loop.

options: A variable that changes by a constant amount each iteration
questions.explanation: An induction variable changes by a constant (or linear function of another induction variable) each iteration.

options: Replicating the loop body to reduce iteration overhead
questions.explanation: Loop unrolling duplicates the loop body multiple times, reducing branch overhead and enabling more optimization.

options: Combining adjacent loops with the same iteration space
questions.explanation: Loop fusion combines multiple loops with compatible iteration spaces into a single loop.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of loop tiling/blocking?
options: Improving cache locality by processing data in blocks
questions.explanation: Loop tiling restructures loops to process data in cache-friendly blocks, improving memory hierarchy utilization.

options: Finding which definitions may reach each program point
questions.explanation: Reaching definitions determines which variable assignments might reach (still be valid at) each program point.

options: Determining which variables may be used before being redefined
questions.explanation: Live variable analysis finds variables whose values may be used in the future before being overwritten.

questions.prompt: What is a forward vs backward data flow analysis?
options: Forward propagates from entry; backward from exit
questions.explanation: Forward analyses flow information from entry to exit; backward analyses flow from exit to entry.

options: Determining when pointers/references may refer to the same memory
questions.explanation: Alias analysis determines when two pointer expressions may or must refer to the same memory location.

questions.prompt: Why is precise alias analysis difficult?
options: Undecidable in general; must use conservative approximations
questions.explanation: Precise alias analysis is undecidable; compilers use safe approximations that may miss optimization opportunities.
